title: 1.143 STATE TREE.
text:
The Red pine (Pinus resinosa), more commonly known as Norway pine, is designated as the official state tree of the state of Minnesota.
A photograph of the Red pine, to be obtained and approved by the commissioner of natural resources, shall be certified and preserved in the Office of the Secretary of State.

===: Office of the Secretary of State

photo.location: Office of the Secretary of State
Office of the Secretary of State

variables.name: state_tree.name
variables.description: The name of the state tree.

variables.name: state_tree.scientific_name
variables.description: The scientific name of the state tree.

variables.name: state_tree.common_name
variables.description: The common name of the state tree.

variables.name: photo.status
variables.description: The approval status of the photograph.

variables.name: photo.location
variables.description: The location where the photograph is preserved.

consequences: The Red pine is confirmed as the state tree of Minnesota and its photograph is approved and preserved.
